div.strong: The Pool Rules are Posted at the entrance of Pool; Please read and assist in enforcing these rules so that all may continue to enjoy the pool!

div.div: NO Alcohol allowed at pool. Though there has been leniency, please do not abuse this. There is absolutely NO GLASS BOTTLES allowed at pool. This has cost us money in the past, so this will be strictly enforced. Our community has grown quite a bit in the last year, Safety should be top priority; so it is ever important to adhere to the limit of guests, etc.

div.font: Last, but not least, please be sure to clean up behind yourself. Whether in restroom, or common areas of pool. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact Liberty Community Management/Robin McKay at

span.font: Tuesday, March 8, 2011 – 995 Westmoreland Ln. – 7 pm
New landscaping company for 2011 – Alarcon Landscaping
We will continue cleaning the bathrooms ourselves (Pool committee)
Quarterly Newsletter will continue electronic and/or hand delivered
Liberty Rate per door will remain the same as 2009 and 2010 - $8.75
Advisory committee election in early April
Pool Committee
Determine Opening and Closing dates for the pool.
Cleaning the bathrooms and pool area
Check and replenish toilet paper, hand soap, First aid kit, fire extinguisher, etc.
Close the pool every night at 9:30pm
Take the trash out on Tuesdays – return bin to interior of pool on Wednesday
Keep up with Archer Pool Service for questions about pool maintenance & changes
Maintenance - We need people to fix things around the community and avoid higher rates:
Electric – pool / flood lights at entrance
Fence – broken fence pieces
Plumbing – water fountain, bathroom, etc.
Pool opening and closing event
Bulletin Boards on each entrance
New Pool furniture
Fix sprinkler at first entrance
Change pool lock from key to keypad
Timer for Tennis court lights
Key Lock for Tennis court gate
Pool cover (~$5,000 est.)

td.div:
A special meeting of the Kensington Creek Homeowners Association has been scheduled for:
When: Tuesday, May 18,2010
Time: 7:30 pm
Where: Dacula High School
The purpose of this meeting will be to elect the 2010 Advisory Board for the Community.
If you are interested in serving your community on the Advisory Board send your reason for wanting to serve, your vision for the community and your qualifications to
robin.mckay@libertycm.com or fax: 678-990-9190 or by mail to:
LIBERTY COMMUNITY MANAGEMENT
ATTENTION: ROBIN MCKAY
P.O. BOX 2082 .
LOGANVILLE, GA 30052
*If you are unable to attend the meeting please send your proxy with another member of the community or fax/mail it to Liberty by May 18, 2010. The proxy will count towards the Quorum allowing the community to conduct business at this meeting. The individual you assign your proxy to will be able to vote on your behalf.

First electronic newsletter for Kensington Creek Manor from Liberty Community Management is attached below.
Also Kensington Creek HOA Meeting will be held on Saturday Jan 30,2010 10 am - 11 am
995 Westmoreland Lane.

u.font: There will be a Community Meeting

div.font: In moving forward with the Neighborhood Watch Program, there will be a Block Captain's Meeting set for
If you are interested in being a Block Captain, please arrive on time.

em.font: We would like to get together on Sunday December 6 at 2pm to decorate both entrances.
If you have any bows, garland, wreaths, ribbons, or lights, that you are not using and would like to donate rather than trash, please meet us on
Where we will gather decor, have hot chocolate, and decorate our entrances.

font.font: We look forward to seeing you.

td.div:
Community Meeting - Monday, October 26 - 7:00pm to 8:30pm
Location: Mountain View High School, 2351 Sunny Hill Rd, Lawrenceville, GA 30043-2214
Dear Neighbors: We will have a community meeting this coming Monday to discuss:
- Community watch - Crime Prevention
- 2010 suggested budget
Your presence is VERY important.

font.b: Our Last Community Wide Yard Sale of the year will be Saturday, September 26, 8am-1pm.

p.font: * The yard sale will be placed on Craigslist, as well as AJC.com the week of September 21st.
* We will put the yard sale sign in front of the community on September 23rd
* We will hand out ballons to place on your mailbox to assist in directing buyers to your homes.

Balloon hand out will be on September 23rd
If you are interested, please respond to this fill out the form below with your name/address, so that we have a count of balloons needed.

b.i: Also, please share this information with your neighbors in case they are not signed up to receive emails.

p.font: The crime problem in our nation is both costly and demoralizing. Directly or indirectly, we are all affected by crime that has caused injury, financial loss and intimidation. These situations demonstrate vividly the need for community involvement and assistance in crime prevention.
This has been a subject of conversations amongst many neighbors. Now is your chance to take that active role to protect our community.

We contacted the Gwinnett County Police Crime Prevention Unit and got the information to start the Neighborhood Watch. THEIR #1 REQUIREMENT IS THAT WE MUST HAVE 65% OF THE COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION in order to start the program (85+ residents).

Once we compile the signatures, we will be assigned an Officer who will meet with the community in regards to the program, answering questions, and getting the program started; we then will become C.O.P.S.

C.O.P.S. stands for Community Oriented Police Services and is a neighborhood watch program set up by the Gwinnett County Police Crime Prevention Unit. There are currently more than one hundred fifty (150) Gwinnett communities participating in the C.O.P.S. program. The purpose of C.O.P.S. is to create a police/community partnership to reduce the likelihood of crime occurring in your area. This is accomplished by many techniques including the training of residents on how to resolve neighborhood problems.
Thru the Neighborhood Watch Program we will be able to:

font.b: See more police officers on patrol in our neighborhood

li.font: Address any speeding and other traffic offenses taking place in our neighborhood
Address ordinance violations (junk cars, graffiti, etc) in our neighborhood

font.b: THIS IS YOUR CHANCE TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE FOR YOU, YOUR FAMILY, YOUR HOME, AND COMMUNITY.

p.font: To collect signatures, stop by the pool on one of the following dates:

font.b: visit our community web page for updates & details:

Our new board was elected the Community meeting.
The board consists of :
Al Ansley
Marta Serrano
Angelina Henderson

Community meeting to elect a new Board. This meeting will be at Dacula High School at 7:00 pm. PLEASE MARK YOUR CALENDAR AND MAKE SURE YOU ARE THERE.
WE NEED TO CREATE THE COMMITTEES AND BE ORGANIZED before the March 10th meeting.
we will have a revised budget for 2009

TENTATIVE transition meeting date. The meeting will be between Bowen (current Board) Liberty Community and Al Ansley, Yolanda Rivera, and Marta Serrano. Here we will OFFICIALLY request the transition.
we will have the first draft of the transition list that we will present to Bowen - this will include the things we want Bowen to take care of before we take over the community.
3 landscaping companies will provide a quote for their services and we will select the new landscaping company. We have discontinues the current landscaping company services.
we met with the owner of Liberty Community Management and 2 landscaping companies. We will get new quotes and a new landscaping company for the community.
we had our 2nd informal meeting - with a participation of about 18 people - we updated them with everything that was discussed with Liberty and the next steps to be taken.

we visited Liberty Community Management and got clarification on many questions about their services, budget, community, etc. It was a very productive meeting. We got some follow up and actipon items that were going to be addressed in January
1st informal community meeting - with a participation of about 29 people - we herd your concerns load and clear and created a small committee to take these concerns to Liberty Community Management.
